context: When agents are told to 'save memories' or 'save lessons'
lesson: Agents must run log_memory.sh script, NOT create .md files. Added critical warnings in AGENTS.md and created symlinks (save_memories, save_lessons, add_to_swarm_knowledge) all pointing to log_memory.sh so any command works.

context: When MCP server needs to be initialized for agent tooling
lesson: Agents should check if MCP server is running with pgrep before starting it. Added initialization instructions in AGENTS.md: check pgrep -f mcp-server/index.js, then cd to mcp-server and npm start if not running.

context: When agents should query institutional memories
lesson: Agents MUST query memories at critical boundaries: starting tasks, context switching, planning, testing, and after errors. Added explicit WHEN TO CHECK MEMORIES section in AGENTS.md with jq query examples and confidence score guidance.

Added safeguards to log_memory.sh that warn and request confirmation if lesson is >800 chars. Memories should be atomic (3-5 sentences). If work is large, break into multiple focused memories rather than one giant entry.

context: When logging memories based on historical git commits
lesson: Added --timestamp parameter to log_memory.sh so agents can specify commit date as memory timestamp instead of current time. This preserves timeline integrity when retroactively capturing learnings from git history.

context: When agents work in ix directory but need agent memory scripts
lesson: Copied full AGENTS.md to ix directory root and added AGENT_SWARM_PATH environment variable setup to AGENT_INSTRUCTION.txt. Agents starting in ix can export AGENT_SWARM_PATH then access all memory scripts and docs.

context: When documenting MCP client configuration status
lesson: Created MCP_CONFIG_STATUS.md documenting Claude Desktop and Codex terminal MCP setup. Confirmed VSCode, Warp, iTerm, ChatGPT do not natively support MCP. Included test commands and troubleshooting for both configured clients.

context: When clarifying context vs lesson fields in memory logging
lesson: Updated WRITE.md to clarify: --context describes the trigger condition (when X happens), --lesson is the detailed UX-translated explanation (what and why). Context is the situation, lesson is the knowledge. Updated all examples accordingly.

context: When wrapping up agent memory system session work
lesson: Completed: critical agent behavior fixes preventing .md file creation, MCP initialization instructions, query timing guidance, memory size safeguards, timestamp preservation, cross-repo access, and documentation clarifications. All changes committed and pushed to internal repo.
